com.dukascopy.api.system

Interface IClient

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ITesterClient

    public interface IClient
    Main entry point for the connection to the server

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect(java.lang.String jnlp,
           java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password)
             throws JFAuthenticationException,
                    JFVersionException,
                    java.lang.Exception
        Authenticates and connects to dukascopy servers
        Parameters:
        jnlp - address of jnlp file, that is used to launch platform
        username - user name
        password - password
        Throws:
        JFAuthenticationException - authentication error, incorrect username or password, IP address unrecognized in case of LIVE systems
        JFVersionException - version is blocked on the server, update your libraries
        java.lang.Exception - all kinds of errors that resulted in exception

      • connect

        void connect(java.lang.String jnlp,
           java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password,
           java.lang.String pin)
             throws JFAuthenticationException,
                    JFVersionException,
                    java.lang.Exception
        Authenticates and connects to dukascopy servers
        Parameters:
        jnlp - address of jnlp file, that is used to launch platform
        username - user name
        password - password
        pin - pin code generated with the captcha from the last getCaptchaImage(java.lang.String) call
        Throws:
        JFAuthenticationException - authentication error, incorrect username or password, IP address unrecognized in case of LIVE systems
        JFVersionException - version is blocked on the server, update your libraries
        java.lang.Exception - all kinds of errors that resulted in exception

      • getCaptchaImage

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage getCaptchaImage(java.lang.String jnlp)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the image that can be provided to the user to generate correct pin code
        Parameters:
        jnlp - address of jnlp file, that is used to launch platform
        Returns:
        captha image
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if request for captcha failed

      • reconnect

        void reconnect()
        Tries to reconnect transport without reauthenticating. Method is asynchronous, meaning it will exit immidiately after sending connection request without waiting for the response. Caller will receive notification through ISystemListener interface

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Stops all running strategies and disconnect from dukascopy server.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if client is authenticated authorized and transport is in connected state
        Returns:
        true if there is open and working connection to the server

      • startStrategy

        long startStrategy(IStrategy strategy)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          java.lang.NullPointerException
        Starts the strategy with default exception handler that will stop strategy if it trows exception
        Parameters:
        strategy - strategy to run
        Returns:
        returns id assigned to the strategy
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not connected
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the parameters is null

      • startStrategy

        long startStrategy(IStrategy strategy,
                 IStrategyExceptionHandler exceptionHandler)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          java.lang.NullPointerException
        Starts the strategy
        Parameters:
        strategy - strategy to run
        exceptionHandler - if not null then passed exception handler will be called when strategy throws exception
        Returns:
        returns id assigned to the strategy
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not connected
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the parameters is null

      • runPlugin

        java.util.UUID runPlugin(Plugin plugin,
                       IStrategyExceptionHandler exceptionHandler)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                java.lang.NullPointerException
        Starts the plugin
        Parameters:
        strategy - strategy to run
        exceptionHandler - if not null then passed exception handler will be called when strategy throws exception
        Returns:
        returns id assigned to the strategy
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not connected
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the parameters is null

                       IStrategyExceptionHandler exceptionHandler,
                       PluginGuiListener pluginGuiListener)

                                java.lang.NullPointerException
        Starts the strategy
        Parameters:
        strategy - strategy to run
        exceptionHandler - if not null then passed exception handler will be called when strategy throws exception
        Returns:
        returns id assigned to the strategy
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not connected
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the parameters is null

        Returns:

        Throws:

        Stops the strategy with the specified id
        Parameters:

      • getStartedStrategies

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,IStrategy> getStartedStrategies()
        Returns map with ids mapped to associated strategies. Includes only strategies started by the current process.
        Returns:
        started strategies

      • getRunningPlugins

        java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,Plugin> getRunningPlugins()
        Returns map with ids mapped to associated strategies
        Returns:
        started strategies

      • removeNewsFilter

        Returns:

      • setSubscribedInstruments

        void setSubscribedInstruments(java.util.Set<Instrument> instruments)
        Subscribes to the specified instruments set. Ticks passed in onTick method will have full depth for this instruments, while other instruments are not guaranteed to have full depth.
        Parameters:
        instruments - set of the instruments

      • getSubscribedInstruments

        java.util.Set<Instrument> getSubscribedInstruments()
        Returns subscribed instruments
        Returns:
        set of the subscribed instruments

      • setOut

        void setOut(java.io.PrintStream out)
        Sets stream that will be passed to the strategy through IConsole. Default out is System.out
        Parameters:
        out - stream

      • setErr

        void setErr(java.io.PrintStream err)
        Sets stream that will be passed to the strategy through IConsole. Default err is System.err
        Parameters:
        err - stream

      • setCacheDirectory

        void setCacheDirectory(java.io.File cacheDirectory)
        Sets the location of the cache files. Default is System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir") + "/.cache"

        The method should get called before the call of connect(String, String, String).

        WARNING: JForex might delete all folder's content if folder already existed AND was not created by this method call.

        Parameters:
        cacheDirectory - directory where cache files should be saved

      • compileStrategy

        void compileStrategy(java.lang.String srcJavaFile,
                   boolean obfuscate)
        Compile .java strategy file to .jfx file. Destination .jfx file will be located in the same directory as the source.
        Parameters:
        srcJavaFile - .java source file to be compiled
        obfuscate - if true, the strategy will be obfuscated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not connected

      • packPluginToJfx

        java.io.File packPluginToJfx(java.io.File file)
        Packs .java or .jar strategy file to .jfx file. Destination .jfx file will be located in the same directory as the source.
        Parameters:
        file - .java or .jar source file to be packed
        Returns:
        the packed jfx file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not connected

      • addClientGUIListener

        Register a IClientGUIListener which is "interested" in open / close charts from strategy
        Parameters:
        clientGuiListener - IClientGUIListener

      • removeClientGUIListener

        void removeClientGUIListener(IClientGUIListener clientGuiListener)
        Unregister a IClientGUIListener
        Parameters:
        clientGuiListener - IClientGUIListener

      • openChart

        IChart openChart(IFeedDescriptor feedDescriptor)
        Opens new chart with specified in IFeedDescriptor parameters.
        Parameters:
        feedDescriptor -
        Returns:
        IChart newly created chart
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when feedDescriptor not formed well

      • closeChart

        void closeChart(IChart chart)
        Close specified chart.
        Parameters:
        chart -

      • getClientGUI

        IClientGUI getClientGUI(IChart chart)
        Returns IClientGUI for specified IChart.
        NOTE: Can be used only by Standalone JForex API. There is no access to embedded chart's panels from JForex Platform.
        Parameters:
        chart - IChart
        Returns:
        IClientGUI for specified IChart, or null if it's not Standalone JForex API environment.

      • getAvailableInstruments

        java.util.Set<Instrument> getAvailableInstruments()
        Returns a set of operable for the current user instruments. Use this method to get all available instruments. If there is no instruments available, the method return empty set.
        Returns:
        Set of available instruments

      • getPreferences

        IPreferences getPreferences()
        Returns global preference holder for JForex-SDK
        Returns:
        global preference holder for JForex-SDK

      • setPreferences

        void setPreferences(IPreferences preferences)
        Sets global preferences for JForex-SDK Consider hiding the position labels and the closed positions from charts (needs to be called after a successful connection): 
         IPreferences pref = client
     .getPreferences().chart().orders()
           .entryOrders(true)
     .preferences().chart().positions()
           .positionExternalIdLabels(false)
           .closedPositions(false)
           .openPositions(true)
     .preferences();
 client.setPreferences(pref);

      • getRemoteStrategyManager

        IRemoteStrategyManager getRemoteStrategyManager()
        Returns a manager for remote strategy running, stopping and monitoring
        Returns:
        a manager for remote strategy running, stopping and monitoring
